Class MerkleHellmanKnapsack

  • java.lang.Object
    • MerkleHellmanKnapsack

  • public class MerkleHellmanKnapsack
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation of Merkle-Hellman Knaosack Encryption and Decryption algorithm using up to 80 bytes of data.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MerkleHellmanKnapsack()
      constructor with no parameters initializes w and b

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] decrypt(java.math.BigInteger output)
      Takes an encrypted message as a BigInteger value as input and decrypts it according to Merkle-Hellman Knapsack algoritm

      Best Case: Big Theta (n^2)
      Worst Case: Big Theta (n^2)
      Pre-condition: The keys used for encryption must be used for decryption as well
      Post-condition: The decrypted output bytes must be printable as readable characters and not a bit output stream
      java.math.BigInteger encrypt(byte[] input)
      Takes an array of bytes as input and encryptes it using Merkle-Hellman Knapsack algorithm

      Best Case: Big Theta (n^2)
      Worst Case: Big Theta (n^2)
      Pre-condition: Input cannot be greater than 80 bytes
      Post-condition: Final encrypted number must be a single BigInteger
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Test driver for MerkleHellmanKnapsack.java

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        public java.math.BigInteger encrypt(byte[] input)
        Takes an array of bytes as input and encryptes it using Merkle-Hellman Knapsack algorithm

        Best Case: Big Theta (n^2)
        Worst Case: Big Theta (n^2)
        Pre-condition: Input cannot be greater than 80 bytes
        Post-condition: Final encrypted number must be a single BigInteger
        Parameters:
        input - An array of bytes that we want to encrypt
        Returns:
        BigInteger value representing the encrypted message

      • decrypt

        public byte[] decrypt(java.math.BigInteger output)
        Takes an encrypted message as a BigInteger value as input and decrypts it according to Merkle-Hellman Knapsack algoritm

        Best Case: Big Theta (n^2)
        Worst Case: Big Theta (n^2)
        Pre-condition: The keys used for encryption must be used for decryption as well
        Post-condition: The decrypted output bytes must be printable as readable characters and not a bit output stream
        Parameters:
        intput - BigInteger message to decrypt
        Returns:
        Byte array of decreypted message

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test driver for MerkleHellmanKnapsack.java
        Parameters:
        args -
